## Storing `par()` Defaults

It's a bad practice to tweak `par()` with your plots and not restore the
defaults. There are two ways of tackling this:

**In a block of code**:

```{R}
opar <- par(no.readonly=TRUE)
# ... your plot here ...
par(opar)
```

**In a function**:

```{R}
cool_plot_function <- function() {
  opar <- par(no.readonly=TRUE)
  on.exit(par(opar))
}
```
